channel.title: Comments on: Tictail API launch focuses on UX

item.title: By: Bruno Pedro
item.dc:creator: Bruno Pedro
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/09/19/tictail-api-launch-focuses-ux/#comment-258">Gavin Johnson (@snow6oy)</a>.
I think this is a great strategy: aligning their internal product to their API makes both improve a lot more over time.
I do understand your concern that product development might suffer from using the same API that users are consuming but, if your number one priority is offering users the best possible experience, that shouldn't be an issue.

item.title: By: Gavin Johnson (@snow6oy)
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson (@snow6oy)
item.description: What interests me is this "they decided to offer developers the same tools they use internally to build this new platform". Do they really mean exactly the same tools? Was it that their internal API was already suitable for external consumption. Seems like a happy accident. And now their internal and external APIs are tightly coupled, will development continue to remain agile.
